hero.title: UberCab — 2008 Original Pitch Deck
hero.subtitle: A historical deck reviewed through a static investment-committee simulation.

cards.title: Demand signal
cards.summary: Clear user pain around taxi access and reliability in dense urban corridors.

cards.title: Operational fragility
cards.summary: Marketplace balancing and driver liquidity assumptions remain unproven.

cards.title: Regulatory overhang
cards.summary: City-by-city compliance risk may slow expansion and increase burn.

personas.name: Product-led Optimist
personas.summary: Sees a strong wedge with premium convenience and retention upside.

personas.name: Operations Skeptic
personas.summary: Challenges assumptions around supply quality and response times.

personas.name: Regulatory Realist
personas.summary: Flags litigation and policy friction as expansion constraints.

rounds.title: Round 1 — Initial IC pass
rounds.summary: Team agrees category timing is favorable but asks for deeper operating data.

rounds.title: Round 2 — Counterfactual stress test
rounds.summary: Downside model highlights thin margins under slower supply growth.

rounds.title: Round 3 — Decision gate
rounds.summary: Proceed with disciplined check size and milestone-based follow-up.

stage_4.summary: Compelling demand and timing offset by meaningful execution and policy risk.
insights: Consumer pull is likely real in dense markets
Unit economics require strict operational control
Regulatory strategy should be treated as product work
questions: Which market archetypes sustain margins earliest?
How quickly can legal blockers be resolved?
plans: Run sensitivity by utilization and idle time
